item.title: Gaining Entry to the EU's Financial Services Market in the Absence of a Brexit Deal
item.description: Bartlomiej Kulpa, LLM (Twitter: @KulpaBart) Introduction When Boris Johnson became British Prime Minister, a no-deal Brexit appeared increasingly possible. UK-based financial services firms were left wondering if and how they would be able to continue serving clients in the remaining 27 EU countries. These firms currently depend on “passporting rights,” which allow them to operate across borders. According to The Economist, in 2016, 5,476 British financial services firms used 336,421 European passports to offer their products across the EU.
